title: New Lobbying Group Hopes to Shape New York's Economic Recovery
summary: Campaign to resist proposed taxes on wealthy and push to make expanded outdoor dining permanent. A coalition of civic and business leaders in New York is pushing back on proposals to raise taxes as a result of the coronavirus pandemic, and says it will spend millions to advance efforts to help the state's economic recovery.

title: TikTok Is Suing the U.S. Government
summary: A complaint filed by the video-sharing app says President Trump's executive order "violates the due process protections of the Fifth Amendment". TikTok sued the U.S. government in federal court Monday, saying that it protects its users' data and challenging President Trump's executive order that would effectively ban the video-sharing app if it doesn't find an American buyer for its U.S. operations. In the lawsuit, TikTok's lawyers said: "By banning TikTok with no notice or opportunity to be heard (whether before or after the fact), the executive order violates the due process protections of the Fifth Amendment." U.S. officials say they are concerned that TikTok, owned by Beijing-based ByteDance, could pass on data it collects from Americans streaming videos to China's government. TikTok has said it hasn't been asked to share data with the Chinese government and wouldn't do so if asked.

title: TikTok Investors Press for a Sale to Oracle
summary: Investment firms with large existing stakes in ByteDance pursue deal for app's U.S. operations, as potential alternative to Microsoft. General Atlantic and Sequoia Capital, two major investors in TikTok's Chinese parent company, are maneuvering to be part of a deal to acquire the U.S. operations of the popular video-sharing app as it seeks to avoid a ban by the Trump administration, according to people familiar with the discussions.

title: The FDA's Good Plasma Decision
summary: Ignore Trump's tweet. This is the right decision based on the science.. Here we go again. President Trump hypes a Covid-19 therapy that has shown potential based on early studies. The Food and Drug Administration approves the treatment for emergency use and gets lambasted for letting politics influence the science.

title: About Joe's Energy Jobs
summary: Building trades workers prefer their oil and gas gigs to a green promise.. Joe Biden has a message for the fossil-fuel workers he admits he'll be putting out of work: I have an even better job for you. So why is the nation's premier building-trade federation warning its members not to believe it?

title: Georgia's Pandemic Progress
summary: The state projected a budget hole of $1 billion. Actual: $210 million.. Remember when the national press corps portrayed Georgia Governor Brian Kemp as a villain for reopening the state's economy too soon? Well, more than a few states would like to be in the Peach State's pandemic and fiscal position now.

title: Pompeo Urges Arab States to Follow U.A.E. in Striking Deals With Israel
summary: U.S. officials hope to announce at least one more deal between Israel and an Arab country in coming weeks. TEL AVIV-Secretary of State Mike Pompeo urged Arab countries to join the United Arab Emirates in forging formal ties with Israel, as part of a U.S. diplomatic push to align old enemies in the Middle East against a common rival in Iran.

title: Salesforce, Amgen, Honeywell to Join Dow Jones Industrial Average
summary: Companies will replace Exxon, Pfizer, Raytheon in index. The Dow Jones Industrial Average is getting a makeover.

title: Money Funds Waive Charges to Keep Yields From Falling Below Zero
summary: Roughly $5 trillion industry faces pressure as interest rates plummet. Many investment firms are waiving their charges on money funds to keep the yields that investors earn from dropping below zero.

title: Arm Ltd. Halts Spinoff of Two Internet of Things Businesses to SoftBank
summary: U.K.-based Arm announced plans for the spinoff to its parent company a month ago. Mobile phone chip designer Arm Ltd. has called off a planned spinoff of two businesses to parent company SoftBank Group Corp. as the Japanese investment firm evaluates options for the semiconductor company it bought four years ago for $32 billion.

title: The Pentagon Is Prepared for China
summary: The PLA serves Beijing's authoritarian goals. The U.S. and our allies are ready to defend every front.. China's People's Liberation Army celebrated its 93rd anniversary Aug. 1 with a speech by Chinese Communist Party General Secretary Xi Jinping. Once again, Mr. Xi called for transforming the PLA into a world-class military, one that can further the party's agenda far beyond China's shores. His remarks serve as a stark reminder that we have entered a new era of global competition between the free and open international order and an authoritarian system fostered by Beijing.

title: The U.S. Admits Too Few Refugees
summary: America should open its doors to those fleeing communism and religious persecution.. While President Trump has rightly critiqued the autocratic tendencies of socialism, on his administration's watch the U.S. has increasingly turned away victims of communism and religious persecution. In 2016, before Mr. Trump took office, slightly under 85,000 refugees were admitted to America. Since then, the administration has systematically slashed the ceiling for refugee arrivals, resulting in a historically low cap of 18,000 for this fiscal year. Only about 8,602 have been permitted entrance so far-on track for a decline of almost 90% from 2016.

title: When the Post Office Was the Bomb
summary: Postmaster Summerfield had an explosive idea to win back the public.. The postmaster general was in a pickle.

title: Democrats Again Press DeJoy on Postal Changes, Voting by Mail
summary: Postmaster general faces another round of questions on Capitol Hill amid efficiency drive. WASHINGTON-Postmaster General Louis DeJoy said the U.S. Postal Service is working to fix delivery delays as Democrats continued to press him about slowdowns and operational changes that they worry could hamper voting by mail.

title: 'Feasting Wild' Review: To Taste the Untamed
summary: A bracing travelogue by a culinary forager seeking rare, undomesticated, unadulterated foods in the rapidly disappearing wild.. Gina Rae La Cerva wishes we all ate a little wilder. Wild like humans ate for 99% of their history: hunting and gathering undomesticated and uncultivated foods. Wild like Henry David Thoreau preferred his fruits: native berries plucked from the bush, bittersweet white-oak acorns nibbled on a "bleak November walk." Oranges, bananas, pineapples and other farmed "table fruits," Thoreau said, "do not feed the imagination as these wild fruits do."

title: Joe Biden's Leap of Faith
summary: It's not just abortion. The Democrats' stand on religious liberty should trouble voters.. By now Joe Biden's rosary must be the most famous beads in the world.

title: Notable & Quotable: Enough
summary: 'Stop torturing small-business owners with nonsensical regulations and unfair enforcement.'. Karol Markowicz, writing in the New York Post on Aug. 24:

title: Texas, Louisiana Brace as Storm Strengthens
summary: Forecasters see midweek landfall for system now known as Tropical Storm Laura. The National Hurricane Center issued a hurricane watch stretching from an area in Texas near Houston to western Louisiana as the two states prepared for Tropical Storm Laura to strengthen to a hurricane before making landfall later this week.

title: Bank Regulators Clarify Due-Diligence Requirements for Politically Exposed Persons
summary: Five agencies said in a joint statement that the level of risk associated with politically exposed individuals varies. Banks and financial institutions need to assess money-laundering risks and conduct appropriate due diligence when dealing with foreign public officials and their families or associates, five regulatory agencies said.

title: Guns Are Being Sold on Facebook Marketplace
summary: Firearm sellers are finding new ways to disguise weapon listings after lawmakers called on Mark Zuckerberg to better police the site's Marketplace last year. A year after the Wall Street Journal reported that dozens of would-be sellers in the U.S. were advertising rifles and handguns on Facebook Marketplace as empty boxes, a new tactic has emerged. As Americans buy guns in record numbers, several firearm sellers are now disguising their posts by purporting to sell stickers of gun makers' logos. Private sales of firearms across state lines in the U.S. are meant to be funneled through licensed gun dealers. People barred from owning guns, due to state or federal restrictions, can turn to online exchanges and social-media sites to avoid background checks when making a transaction.

title: Rhode Island Treasurer Says State Pension Won't Back Future Leonard Green Funds
summary: The private-equity firm's investment in hospital operator Prospect Medical has prompted political backlash over the fees and dividends the firm received from the hospital operator under its ownership, among other issues. Rhode Island General Treasurer Seth Magaziner isn't pleased with Leonard Green & Partners' handling of hospital operator Prospect Medical Holdings Inc., and he is showing it through the use of the state pension system's checkbook.

title: New York Attorney General Investigating Trump Organization, President's Assets
summary: New documents ask New York court to order the business and Eric Trump to comply with subpoenas. The New York attorney general's office is investigating whether the Trump Organization and President Trump improperly inflated the value of Mr. Trump's assets in financial filings, according to court papers made public Monday that seek to compel company executives to comply with subpoenas.

title: 'Energy' by Disclosure Review: Back to the Dance Floor
summary: The electronic duo's third album returns to the beckoning grooves of its debut, and benefits from a diverse roster of guest vocalists.

title: Army Corps Demands Wetlands Improvement for Alaska Mine
summary: Letter issued on Monday says mine 'would result in significant degradation'. The Army Corps of Engineers is demanding environmental mitigation measures for a large gold and copper mine planned for Alaska, including restoring, preserving or improving 3,000 acres of wetlands to compensate for the area being disturbed, according to a letter to the developer released Monday.

title: Canada Feels Exposure to U.S. Covid-19 Trends
summary: New-home construction in the U.S. is boosting Canadian timber companies' stocks. The emerging home-building boom is having an echo effect north of the border.

title: Remembering a Total War
summary: This summer marks the 75th anniversary of the end of World War II, and a trove of online offerings exists to let us honor and recall the conflict.. In a Covid-free world, many of us would be traveling this summer to visit battlefields, cemeteries and memorials to commemorate the 75th anniversary of the end of World War II. We'd be remembering Victory in Europe Day (May 8, 1945) and the Sept. 2, 1945, signing of the Japanese surrender in Tokyo Bay by walking across the beaches of Normandy and through the woods around Bastogne or staring into the oily waters beneath the Pearl Harbor National Memorial in Hawaii. Fortunately, there are many online offerings that let us honor and recall the defining conflict of the 20th century.

title: S&P 500 Sets Another High on Treatment Hopes
summary: Benchmark hits third record in past five sessions. U.S. stocks advanced to fresh highs Monday, buoyed by investors' optimism about a potential treatment for coronavirus.

title: Oil Companies Brace for Twin Gulf Coast Storms
summary: Storms Marco and Laura forced shut-ins but are unlikely to send prices at the pump surging as demand remains low and stockpiles high. Oil companies have shut in roughly 82% of offshore oil production in the Gulf of Mexico and are securing refineries and petrochemical plants as two tropical storms barrel toward Louisiana and Texas.

title: World Trade Organization Sides With Canada in Lumber Dispute With U.S.
summary: WTO rules the U.S. incorrectly claimed in 2017 that Canada was improperly subsidizing production. OTTAWA-The World Trade Organization on Monday sided with Canada in the latest flare-up in a decades-old fight with the U.S. over lumber imports, ruling the Trump administration incorrectly claimed in 2017 that its northern neighbor was improperly subsidizing production.

title: New York City, Building Owners Sued for Negligence in Woman's Death
summary: The building had been cited multiple times for failure to maintain the terra cotta, but made no improvements, the suit and public records show. New York City buildings department officials were negligent in allowing the owners of a Midtown building to delay repairs to its damaged facade, where a piece of debris fell and killed a woman last December, according to a lawsuit filed Monday by her family.

title: TikTok Files Suit Challenging U.S. Ban
summary: Trump's executive order would effectively ban the video-sharing app if it doesn't find an American buyer for its U.S. operations. Chinese-owned TikTok sued the U.S. government in federal court Monday, saying that it protects its users' data and challenging President Trump's executive order that would effectively ban the video-sharing app if it doesn't find an American buyer for its U.S. operations.

title: German Medical Tests Show Navalny Was Poisoned
summary: Chancellor Angela Merkel calls on Russia to bring attackers to justice. BERLIN-German Chancellor Angela Merkel called on Russia to investigate an attack on opposition figure Alexei Navalny after German doctors determined on Monday that he had been poisoned with a toxic nerve agent, heightening tension between Moscow and the West.

title: How Do You Play Soccer in a Pandemic? Human Foosball
summary: Argentines adapt the table-top game popular in bars for the field. "It's better than not playing.". When Argentina went into quarantine in March, Ramiro Fabris was forced to shut down the many soccer fields he oversees in the city of Rosario and two nearby towns.

title: Oil and Gasoline Prices Climb Ahead of U.S. Gulf Coast Storms
summary: U.S. energy producers temporarily close some facilities near Gulf of Mexico in anticipation of storms Marco and Laura, which may weigh on supply. Gasoline futures surged to their highest level since early March Monday, lifted by energy supply disruptions caused by back-to-back storms that are on track to hit the Gulf of Mexico this week.

title: China's Economy, Bouncing Back, Gains Ground on U.S.
summary: Resume Subscription. BEIJING-As much of the world struggles to contain the coronavirus, China's recovery is gaining momentum, positioning it to further close its gap with the U.S. economy.

title: DHS Resumes DACA Renewals After a Nearly Monthlong Pause
summary: Processing freeze following acting Secretary Chad Wolf's July memo delayed at least 20,000 applications. WASHINGTON-The Department of Homeland Security said it is resuming renewals of a program protecting immigrants living in the U.S. since childhood without legal permission, nearly a month after it instructed staff to pause on all applications.

title: Researchers Report Covid-19 Reinfection in Hong Kong
summary: A 33-year-old man who recovered from the new coronavirus had an asymptomatic recurrence months later. HONG KONG-A team of researchers has documented a case of Covid-19 reinfection, offering evidence that patients who have recovered from the viral disease could be infected a second time, months after the initial episode.

title: Zoom Restored After Outage Brings Down Virtual Meetings, Classrooms
summary: The videoconferencing company said it has identified and resolved the issue that prevented users from joining meetings or remote classes. Users of videoconferencing app Zoom reported problems with the service Monday morning, just as many students in the U.S. returned to school for virtual classes dependent on the technology.

title: New York Mayor Offers Schools Option to Hold Classes Outdoors
summary: K-12 principals can reopen with access to public parks and closed-off streets, de Blasio says. In an abrupt change of plans concerning the reopening of New York City's schools, New York Mayor Bill de Blasio on Monday announced he will give K-12 principals the option to hold classes outdoors, citing concerns about the air quality and ventilation at schools across the city.

title: Norway's Biggest Private Money Manager Exits From Exxon, Chevron Over Climate Change
summary: Storebrand Asset Management says it sold off more than $47 million in 21 companies. Norway's largest private money manager, Storebrand Asset Management, excluded and divested itself of more than two dozen listed companies under its new climate change policy, citing concerns with lobbying, coal and oil sands.

title: California Is Having More Blackouts. Here's Why.
summary: Millions of people in the state have been warned they may lose power this week. California has experienced rolling blackouts for the first time since the 2001. Millions of people in the state have been warned they may lose power this week. Here's why, according to experts:

title: New Details Revealed of RNC Fundraiser's Lobbying for China
summary: Court case details work of Elliott Broidy and the alleged fraud mastermind who paid him to lobby the Trump administration. A senior Chinese government official enlisted the help of a top fundraising official at the Republican National Committee to lobby the Trump administration in 2017 to return a Chinese businessman living in the U.S. who has long been sought by Beijing, according to a court document filed in Hawaii last week.

title: Affordable Housing, HUD and Local Zoning
summary: If local officials reduce regulatory barriers, housing affordability would be enhanced across the spectrum.. President Trump and HUD Secretary Ben Carson are correct when they say it would be a terrible mistake to put the federal government in charge of local land-use decisions ("We'll Protect America's Suburbs," op-ed, Aug. 17).

title: Harris, SEIU Were Right on Daughters' Sale
summary: Kamala Harris, the attorney general, did her job by protecting the community, particularly the low-wage patients the Daughters of Charity Health System served.. The account offered by your editorial "Getting to Know Kamala Harris" (Aug. 13) bears no resemblance to the actual dynamics of the 2015 sale of Daughters of Charity Health System and entirely misses the central problem in what evolved into both a human tragedy and textbook example of lack of accountability on the part of corporate decision makers.

title: Belarus Detains Two Members of Opposition Council
summary: Fears grow that longtime authoritarian leader Alexander Lukashenko has no intention of ceding power. MOSCOW-At least two members of an opposition-led council formed to help the transfer of power to a new government following Belarus's presidential vote were detained, raising fears that longtime authoritarian leader Alexander Lukashenko has no intention of ceding power.

title: Facebook, TikTok and China
summary: What does the regime demand of technology companies?. There's an interesting phenomenon in which thriving Chinese tech firms assure the world's consumers that they do not and would not comply with unreasonable demands from the Beijing dictatorship. Meanwhile U.S. tech firms can't operate freely in China because of the regime's unreasonable demands. Whom should consumers believe?

title: Canada's Conservative Party Selects Former Military Officer as New Leader
summary: Erin O'Toole, also a former veterans minister, could lead party in election as early as the fall. OTTAWA-Members of Canada's Conservative Party picked Erin O'Toole, a former military officer and veterans minister, to be the new leader in results revealed Monday morning, entrusting him with leading the country's main political opposition party back to power against a scandal-weary Liberal government.

title: As Child Covid Cases Rise, Doctors Watch for Potential Long-Term Effects
summary: Most child cases of Covid are mild. But some kids have longer-term symptoms such as headaches, shortness of breath and gastrointestinal problems.. As more children become infected with Covid-19, doctors are paying closer attention to potential long-term effects.

title: How Not to Be an Antiracist
summary: The focus should be on invidious discrimination, not statistical disparities and social change.. Leaders in business, academia and government are increasingly adopting "antiracist" training and policies in response to the Black Lives Matter movement. In some cases, this reflects genuine interest in decreasing racial discrimination. In others, it is a salve for what Shelby Steele calls "white guilt." Elsewhere, it arises from fear that even liberal institutions may otherwise become vulnerable to cancel culture. When properly conceived, antiracist programs can provide a powerful response to hate and bias incidents. The problem with much of today's antiracism is that it doesn't really oppose invidious discrimination and may even foment it.

title: Elites Yearn for a Restoration Abroad Under Biden
summary: Their recent record, however, is worse than Trump's on the Middle East, Europe and China.. While the Democrats' domestic policy agenda is depicted by opponents as something close to revolution, in foreign policy it's clear that a Joe Biden victory would represent for him, his party and a number of disgruntled Republicans a Glorious Restoration.

title: Owner of Kings and Balducci's Supermarkets Files for Bankruptcy
summary: Regional grocery chain KB US Holdings files for chapter 11 with $75 million buyout offer from TLI Bedrock. The parent of Kings Food Markets and Balducci's has filed for bankruptcy, as a sales boost amid the Covid-19 pandemic wasn't enough to overcome years of pressure from big national chains, online retailers and meal-kit companies.

title: Student-Loan Relief Extended for Public-Sector Workers
summary: Administration clarifies that debt forgiveness lasts through end of year. President Trump's move to suspend most Americans' student-loan payments through the end of the year will deliver extra benefits to public-sector workers, according to a clarification the White House released Friday.

title: White New Yorkers' Income Exceeds Black New Yorkers' in Many Industries
summary: Bill de Blasio's administration promises more city and private-sector support for Black entrepreneurs. New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio has said his administration will address historic inequities in rebuilding the city's economy after the coronavirus pandemic. A new analysis of the wage and employment disparities facing Black New Yorkers shows how hard that will be.

title: White House Touts Opportunity-Zone Tax Break Criticized by Democrats
summary: Trump seeks to expand a program that attracts investment to low-income areas. WASHINGTON-The White House released a report touting the benefits of a program encouraging investment in low-income communities, which Democrats have criticized as a boon to affluent people.

title: Kellyanne Conway to Leave White House
summary: Longtime Trump adviser cites need to support her children during remote learning. WASHINGTON-Kellyanne Conway, one of the longest-serving members of President Trump's White House, will leave the administration at the end of the month, she said Sunday night.

title: New Thinking on Lockdowns: They're Overly Blunt and Costly
summary: Blanket business shutdowns-which the U.S. never tried before this pandemic-led to a deep recession. Economists and health experts say there may be a better way.. In response to the novel and deadly coronavirus, many governments deployed draconian tactics never used in modern times: severe and broad restrictions on daily activity that helped send the world into its deepest peacetime slump since the Great Depression.

title: Trump, Still the Outsider, Sees a Repeat of 2016 Shocker
summary: Having lost ground with some key constituencies, the president's political survival may depend on finding more previously dormant, disaffected voters to energize. If President Trump, down in every significant national poll for more than four months, is worried as he heads into this week's Republican national convention, he isn't exactly showing it.

title: In a Shattered Beirut, Property Predators Circle Storied Neighborhoods
summary: Resume Subscription. BEIRUT-Earlier this year, Tony Kahwaji bought a $2 million apartment in the heart of this city overlooking the Mediterranean, seeking a refuge for his savings after Lebanese banks imposed capital controls amid a deepening financial crisis.

title: Get Comfortable With Extended-Stay Hotels
summary: Real-estate investment trusts that specialize in the category look like a relatively safe bet in the battered lodging sector. You can check out any time you like, but investors risk overlooking some value if they leave the hotel industry behind completely.

title: The NFL Saw an Outbreak. Instead It Learned About Testing Failures.
summary: In one day, the NFL had 77 players and personnel test positive-only for those same people to come up negative upon further tests. At 2:51 a.m. Sunday, Chicago Bears head coach Matt Nagy's phone rang with some very bad news: his team had a coronavirus outbreak. Nine members of the organization had tested positive-the exact type of news that could torpedo this NFL season.

title: How TikTok Convinced Men to Buy Really Short Shorts
summary: Thanks to "5 Inch Inseam TikTok," young men are showing off their thighs in skimpy shorts. ANTHONY FERRARO used to wear khaki shorts that sagged below his knees. It was, said the 24-year-old accountant in New York, a "dark time" in his life, albeit a tragic time that was a mere two months ago. In July, Mr. Ferraro swapped his frumpy calf-kissers for shorts with a five-inch inseam that came to mid-thigh. What spurred this landmark life change? He heeded the call of a snowballing social-media meme promoting the idea that women find men in shorter shorts more attractive than their big-bloomered counterparts. While Mr. Ferraro likes his new abbreviated shorts well enough, he conceded that he's really "just following the trend wherever it goes." TikTok made him do it.

title: How Vail Resorts Could Wipe Out
summary: Investors may be underestimating how challenging this ski season will be. Investors who think Vail Resorts ' business will be anything close to normal in the coming ski season risk mistaking a mountain of trouble for a molehill.

title: This Green Giant Can Get Even Jollier
summary: B&G Foods has recorded a coronavirus-induced sales bonanza and has more room to rally. B&G Foods Inc. has been soaring as the coronavirus crisis juices its sales. There is plenty of room for further gains.

title: I Never Thought I'd Write This: I Am a Female Bodybuilder
summary: A few years ago, I stopped taking care of myself after two kids, my father's death and the end of my marriage took a toll. Then, I discovered bodybuilding-and my outlook on life changed.. Two weeks ago, I stood on a stage in a hotel ballroom wearing a rhinestone bikini small enough to fit into a zip-lock bag.

title: Why One of America's Dreamiest Resorts Is Expanding Right Now
summary: After a tragic loss, Mary Celeste Beall, the Blackberry Farm and Mountain resorts owner, opens a new 15-acre outpost.. "I just love this ride," says Mary Celeste Beall from the driver's seat of a golf cart bound for The Valley, a new 15-acre leisure park at Blackberry Mountain, one of her two resorts outside of Knoxville, Tennessee. The turn off the property's main road immediately gives way to a winding descent, past timber footbridges, waterfalls and sandstone boulders, before merging onto a woodland path that runs beneath a dense canopy of oak and pine. It takes about 10 minutes for the sky to open up and the destination to come into view. On this hazy June afternoon, in the midst of a pandemic that has fundamentally altered American life, it feels almost like a mirage.

title: Big-Box Stores, Worried About Amazon, Were Ready for Coronavirus
summary: Walmart, Target and others had been adding curbside and delivery services, and cashed in when coronavirus pushed sales online. Nearly six months into the coronavirus pandemic in the U.S., big-box retailers are emerging as business winners while competitors-including some apparel sellers and small businesses-struggle.

title: After Top-Up, Rémy Cointreau Is Vulnerable to Spills
summary: French liquor company's shares have gained 28% this year even as earnings forecasts have collapsed. Rémy Cointreau sailed through the 2009 financial crisis, but hopes that the French cognac maker will do the same in this slump might leave a hangover.

title: Patti Smith Isn't Worried About New York City's Future
summary: "I don't know what will happen to our city. I don't know what will happen anywhere. I'll always love New York City.". In our series My Monday Morning, self-motivated people tell WSJ. how they start off the week.

title: New Orleans Braces for Evictions as Renters Fall Behind
summary: Temporary bans to help during the coronavirus pandemic are expiring. Hundreds of renters in New Orleans have received eviction notices this summer due to unpaid rent-and local advocates and officials expect the worst has yet to come, right as hurricane season gets under way.

title: Europe Props Up Jobs While the U.S. Props Up Workers
summary: Wage subsidies keep the EU's official unemployment rate lower than the U.S.'s, but could hold it back in long run. Karren Madere and Andrea Knebel are both victims of the Covid-19 recession. Ms. Madere was laid off in June from her job at a travel-management company, where she negotiated hotel-room rates for corporate clients. Ms. Knebel was sent home in April from her job as a business consultant at an auto-parts factory.

title: Gun Sellers Use New Tactic to Deal on Facebook Marketplace
summary: A year after lawmakers called on Mark Zuckerberg to better police Facebook's second-hand market, gun sales proliferate-this time, disguised as stickers. Gun sellers have adopted a new tactic to attract buyers on Facebook Inc.'s Marketplace-a year after Democratic lawmakers called on Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg to more-effectively police the site's ban on firearm sales.

title: At Least One Company Is Cheering Renewed Aluminum Tariff on Canada
summary: Century Aluminum lobbied for duty that other producers opposed. The Trump administration's decision to reinstate tariffs on Canadian aluminum is a victory for one small U.S. company that out-lobbied competitors wary of imposing new barriers on a key trading partner.

title: The Supporters Buoying Trump's Spirits: Boat Owners
summary: Parades of seagoing Trump fans have been touted by the president and his campaign in the absence of his signature campaign rallies. Trish Willis hasn't returned to her nursing job in Atlanta since the outbreak of Covid-19, and still won't get on an airplane. But she didn't think twice about driving 10 hours to board a stranger's watercraft in a Trump-themed boat parade.

title: Blackstone Makes $2.29 Billion Deal for Japan Drug Business
summary: Takeda Pharmaceutical is selling its consumer health-care business as part of a plan to pay down debt incurred from Shire acquisition. Blackstone Group Inc. is buying the consumer health-care business of Japan's Takeda Pharmaceutical Co. for ¥242 billion ($2.29 billion), one of the larger private-equity acquisitions in a country where such deals are slowly expanding.

title: Luka Doncic and the Bubble Buzzer Beater Heard Round the World
summary: A game-winning shot evens Dallas's playoff with Los Angeles, and ripples beyond the NBA biosphere in Orlando. Behold the remarkable: a sports column, actually about something happening in sports. The following 900 or so words contain no mention of face masks, vaccines, quarantines, testing protocols, college football cancellations, Big Ten mutinies, Dr. Fauci or Zoom calls. There will be a few passing references to the fact that the NBA is playing basketball in a pandemic-provoked bubble, a stunt which remains both remarkable and hilariously bizarre, but they will be brief. I'm serious. I'm not even going to mention my children. (You: Sheesh, finally!) For the first time in nearly six months, this column is really, truly, aggressively about sports.

title: China's Auto Champion Geely Will Rev Up Portfolios
summary: As China's car market grows for the first time in years, its top homegrown brand stands to benefit. With the world's largest car market revving again, Chinese auto maker Geely is poised to shift into a higher gear.

title: Storms Projected to Hit Gulf Coast in 'One-Two Punch'
summary: Tropical Storms Marco and Laura will likely make landfall in Louisiana this week. Two major storms are on track to hit the U.S. Gulf Coast this week, bringing potentially dangerous flooding and surges to Louisiana, Mississippi and Texas.

title: Chinese Home Buyers Paid Huge Deposits but Now Worry They'll Be Left With Nothing
summary: Funding woes at developer Tahoe Group have slowed or stopped projects across the country, leaving buyers who made big down payments in the lurch. Financial stress at an upmarket developer is rattling Chinese families who paid big deposits for unbuilt homes-showing the risks in presales, one of the sector's favorite funding tools in China.

title: Protests Erupt After Police Shoot Black Man in Wisconsin
summary: Kenosha police said a person was hospitalized in serious condition following a shooting by officers. KENOSHA, Wis.-Police officers deployed tear gas here early Monday in an effort to disperse hundreds of protesters after a video posted on social media appeared to show officers shoot a Black man seven times as he leaned into a vehicle.

title: Preserving Trees Becomes Big Business, Driven by Emissions Rules
summary: Resume Subscription. GRUNDY COUNTY, Tenn.-For much of human history, the way to make money from a tree was to chop it down. Now, with companies rushing to offset their carbon emissions, there is value in leaving them standing.

title: Ant Group Pushes Ahead With Listing Plans; Investors See Big IPO Gains
summary: In the coming days, Ant could shed light on what has been a secret for years: how it makes money. When Ant Group Co. goes public later this year, the Chinese financial-technology behemoth will likely earn a stratospheric market valuation that would place it at the top of companies listing globally for the first time.

title: Pandemic Has Online Sellers Leaning on Cloud
summary: Etsy's migration to Google Cloud in the months preceding the pandemic helped it handle a surge in online sales. Retailers more than ever are leaning on cloud computing to capitalize on a surge in online shopping without overloading their information-technology systems.

summary: Army Corps of Engineers expected to recommend the mine not be allowed to move forward without additional mitigation efforts. A massive gold and copper mine planned for Alaska faces widespread opposition in the Trump administration over concerns that the project's developer couldn't resolve environmental risks associated with the project, a senior administration official said Sunday.

title: California Wildfires Grow as Responders Brace for More Blazes
summary: Officials say that lightning storms expected Monday could cause more damage, after five people have been killed and nearly 900 structures destroyed. title: Lego's Next Build: Worlds and Characters Created by Its Fans
summary: The maker of tiny colorful bricks introduces a platform to get its ardent fans, as well as professional creators, to develop story lines and toy ideas. Seeking ideas for TV shows, digital videos and toy sets, Lego A/S is asking people to share their imaginings on a new platform set up for that purpose.

title: Photos: Wildfires Engulf Parts of San Francisco Bay Area
summary: Thousands of people were ordered to evacuate the Bay Area, as wildfires blazed across California amid a blistering heat wave and high winds. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: BTS 'Dynamite' Smashes YouTube's 24-Hour Music Debut Record
summary: The K-pop group's English music video attracts more than 101 million views on the streaming platform within 24 hours. SEOUL-K-pop sensation BTS smashed the one-day record for the most viewed YouTube music video with "Dynamite," reinforcing the band's world-wide reach as they continue to make waves in the global music scene.

title: GOP, at Convention, to Call for Keeping Economy Open
summary: Republicans will set up a contrast with Democrats' willingness to keep Americans home to combat coronavirus. WASHINGTON-Republicans will use their national convention this week to defend some in-person activities as essential to keeping the economy humming, setting up a contrast with Democrats' calls to keep Americans at home if the coronavirus pandemic worsens.

title: With U.S. Backing, Iraq Pushes for Energy Rapprochement With Saudis
summary: Electrical grid tie-ups with Riyadh and Kuwait would reduce Baghdad's dependency on Iran. The Trump administration is urging Iraq to proceed with a project to connect its power grid with Saudi Arabia and other Gulf states, among steps to reduce Baghdad's longstanding dependency on Iranian energy, U.S. and Arab officials said.

title: Facebook's CEO Stoked Washington's Fears About TikTok
summary: Social-media tycoon emphasized threat from Chinese internet companies as he worked to fend off U.S. regulation of Facebook. When Facebook Inc. Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg delivered a speech about freedom of expression in Washington, D.C., last fall, there was also another agenda: to raise the alarm about the threat from Chinese tech companies and, more specifically, the popular video-sharing app TikTok.
